name: Hampton Inn & Suites Albany - Downtown

reviews.text: The hotel was reasonably priced for the location, but I was not 100% sure if it is a very safe location. My colleague went out for a run outside before breakfast, so I concluded that it must not be all that bad.
reviews.title: Decent hotel

reviews.text: The hotel itself was very clean. I was happy with the cleanliness of my room, and comfort of my bed. They had the regular Hampton Inn breakfast (some hot stuff, and bread, muffin, fruit, cereal etc).
reviews.title: No complaints

likes.disliked: — small fitness center that did not open until 6 AM

reviews.text: The front desk people were helpful. The parking system was a bit confusing.
reviews.title: Excellent Downtown Hotel

likes.liked: — The quality of the bedding and the bathroom.

reviews.text: I just spent two days as part of a conference and was impressed with the ability for the hotel to run a conference and the quality of the food in the restuarant. Breakfast was part of the hotel rate and was the typical "hot Continental breakfast" found in many hotels. Coffee available 24 hours was good; fitness room did not open until 6 AM, which can be an issue. Hotel was close to the river bike/pedestrian path, so that was good. Good selection of towels and bedding was very comfortable. Lots of TV stations, plenty of room to spread out. My room was on backside, so no noise complaints. Temp control was good.
reviews.title: Good location and amenities

likes.disliked: — No hot food at breakfast buffet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed here twice now. The hotel is immaculately clean. The bedding is outstanding. Be sure to ask for a room on the back side of the hotel, as the front side overlooks the happening downtown Albany bar scene. It is loud late. Lots of bars and restaurants within walking distance. Parking is an additional $12, which is a little annoying. It's Albany, not NYC!
reviews.title: Fantastic!
It was fine....
reviews.text: The hotel was fairly easy to get to once I figured out where to park - there is a parking attendant to make sure you have your keys ready!
The front desk was very nice checking us in; the restaraunt had great food, though a little slow.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was good with a gorgeous bathroom! Our view was the parking lot but that was fine with me. The immediate area was very small town-like with concert hall right up the street.
reviews.title: great experience
The Albany Hampton Inn (Downtown) - nice!
reviews.text: Getting back on the road was no problem as well. I would come to this hotel again if I'm back in the downtown Albany area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall this is a nice place to stay in Albany. I was there on business for 5 nights and was pleased with the hotel. Rooms were nice and new, bathroom was big and beds were comfortable. Staff seemed friendly. Location was good, right downtown and in walking distance of many bars and restaurants. The only thing that was strange was that some of that staff that cleaned the rooms were men dressed in jeans and t-shirts. It was kind of wierd - seemed like they didn't belong.
reviews.title: Experience at teh Hampton Inn Downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed here for one night. This appears to be a fairly new property. Check is was a breeze.
reviews.title: Nice Stay - Typical Hampton Inn

likes.disliked: — The noise from the street at 12:30 AM.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the 9th floor overlooking the downtown area. Comfy beds and linens. Weird thing - only one garbage can for the room. It was in the bathroom. The free internet worked fine for us.
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.text: My only complaint is the soundproofing of the windows. At 12:30 in the morning we were awaken by the sound of people out and about in the neighborhood across from the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice location

likes.disliked: — walls paper was olders and worn

reviews.text: Since we stayed on a Friday evening, we found free parking on the street around the corner from the hotel. No need to feed the meters after 6:00 PM or on the weekend.
reviews.title: Nice Shower

likes.liked: — The bed / the Shower / room was very comfortable. Well decorated lobby and rooms.
likes.disliked: — A sub-par continental breakfast on Easter Sunday / No breakfast in main resturant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was typical a la styrofoam. Coffee's pretty decent.
reviews.title: Not great....not terrrible

reviews.text: Spent a couple of nights over the St Patricks Day weekend. The rooms were nice and the lobby, business center and location were more than fine.
reviews.title: So-So

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They even gave me an early check-in after I pleased my case with them.
reviews.title: Decent

likes.disliked: — overly bright lighting, no mirror in bathroom, windows don't open

reviews.title: Decent new property. Questionable hiring practices
reviews.text: However, they really dropped the ball when it came to parking. I wasn't able to park in their supervides lot around back due to all the St Patty's Day revelers. I was forced to park my car on the street next to an adjacent snow bank overnight.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I voiced my displeasure to the front desk staff. However, they gave me the look of "pound sand" and didn't want to help. What torqued me more than anything was the fact that they were letting their employees park in the lot ahead of guests. One employee pulled in right after stated my case, double parked his vehicle, and walked right in to go to work as if nothing was wrong!
reviews.title: Nice but not that clean

reviews.text: For that reason alone, I'd probably head up the street to the Crowne Plaza where they have a huge parking deck adjacent to the hotel.
reviews.title: Very Happy w/ the Hampton Inn

reviews.text: I think some of the people that post reviews on this site are never satisfied. The rate was high and the valet parking a bit inconvenient, but this is the nicest Hampton Inn I've ever seen (HH Diamond VIP here, have seen a lot). Everything new, beautiful rooms, flat screen and some flat panel HDTV TV's. Bedding is very comfortable. There are several nice bars and places to eat within walking distance.
reviews.title: Great property
Nice rooms, but poorly designed hotel
reviews.text: I have a bit of a struggle deciding whether to assign this hotel a neutral (3-dot) or above average (4-dot) rating. This hotel is less than a year old as of this writing, and was apparently built from the ground up from a vacant lot, according to their website. Since the hotel was built from scratch and not retrofitted, I'm not sure why so little thought went into the design of the hotel. Let me explain.

reviews.title: No complaints
reviews.text: The rooms are, as one would expect, modern, fairly large, and comfortable with new fixtures. The internet connection worked very well. I also found the rooms quiet (I was on the 6th floor). The gym was small but adequate with everything in working order. No pool. Despite letting them know I was HHonors Gold, they quoted some absurd sum to use the sauna or steam room ($15 per half hour as I recall), so we didn't use it needless to say. As happens more than half the time at Hampton Inns, I was not recognized as a Gold HHonors, and had to call the front desk to remind them to bring me a bottle of water and snack (despite the fact that I had e-checked in through [--]).

Here's the bad design paragraph. This hotel has 10 floors with 121 regular rooms and 44 suites. Although the elevators are quite fast, who in his right mind would think that two small elevators would be adequate to handle the traffic? At times they were so full that people could not cram in further and had to wait for another elevator. Also, the breakfast area was tiny and had only two toasters, each capable of handling one English muffin or one bagel. One would think that anyone with at least 9 or 10 neurons in his brain could figure out that this wouldn't be adequate for a hotel of this size. People litterally had to eat standing up.
reviews.title: Very Nice !

reviews.text: The parking situation was also bad. When we brought the car in, we were asked for and gave them the time we would be leaving. When we arrived at exactly the stated time, however, our car was against the fence with at least three cars in front of it and on either side. Obviously this ended up being a rather time-consuming experience. Wasn't it obvious to someone when they were building the hotel that it would need a modest parking structure rather than a tiny lot?
reviews.title: Hampton Inn - Fair to Middling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate at a great restaurant on South Pearl Street called Jillian's (about 2 blocks away). It's a sports bar with great food, and the service was excellent, and I highly recommend trying it if you decide to stay at the Hampton.
reviews.title: Excellent Downtown Albany Choice

likes.liked: — Clean, new, great location, great amenities, friendly & accomodating staff
likes.disliked: — Parking fee $10, higher rates on 'event weekends'

reviews.title: Hampton Was Nice
reviews.text: Arrived at the new Hampton Inn & Suites Downtown Albany at about 10:00 a.m. and they glady welcomed us to check in early.
Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was very clean and all new furnishings.
reviews.title: Pretty nice hotel.

aka: Hampton Inn & Suites Albany - Downtown Hotel Albany
description: The upscale downtown Albany hotel features 121 lavishly-appointed guest rooms, 35 suites with microwaves and refrigerators, eight whirlpool suites and one executive 2-room suite. The new hotel boasts wired and wireless Internet access, complimentary On the House® hot breakfast, on-site exercise facility with sauna and steam room, plenty of meeting space (we specialize in law firm deposition meetings), fresh hot coffee and tea in the lobby 24/7 and, of course, Hilton HHonors® points and miles for your stay. Eleven accessible rooms are available. All rooms and suites are smoke free and feature the Clean and Fresh Hampton Bed™. Welcome to Albany’s brightest new star!Yono’s Restaurant, and dp, an American Brasserie, share space near the entrance of the Hampton Inn & Suites! Just a step through the doorway for hotel guests, this upscale fine-dining restaurant features creative continental and Indonesian cuisine for a memorable dining experience.The Hampton Inn & Suites Albany Downtown is centrally and conveniently located to many downtown attractions, government buildings and points of interest. Business travelers will enjoy easy access to the area’s many businesses and corporations.
